Posts.Content: Oct 17, 2010 01:26PM - edited Aug 20, 2013 04:57AM by Godlistens HI. I went for three opinions for both my surgeon and oncologist. All three oncologists said I was eligible to take the Oncotype test. Even my surgeon mentioned it - and this was three years ago. It seems to be standard practice at this point. HOpe this helps.
Posts.Title: Use of Oncotype lola12 kira1234

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2011 04:42PM Godlistens wrote: you are entitled to be sad and worried and depressed. I am 3.5 years out, and I still worry. My prognosis was good, no node involvement, low oncotype but we all know that cancer is a very unpredictable disease and sometimes will defy the statistics. that is always in the back of my mind.  And i also feel that if my body produced cancer cells once, it can certainly do it again. I try NOT to worry about every ache and pain - the Tamoxifen makes me very achy. I struggle with what I should worry about, when I should call the doctor, what are menopause symptoms, and what are side effects from the medication???  It is never ending in the minds of BC patients. I know!  I try to keep my mind busy so that I don't spiral downward into the worry zone. Good luck to you......I pray that you can deal with this diagnosis and move on with your life.
Posts.Title: Depression Over Good Prognosis? huntreiter3 Momine

Posts.Content: Oct 17, 2010 02:29PM Godlistens wrote: Hi ladies! I am new to this site and am enjoying all of your posts. I am a three year survivor and counting!!  Congrats to all of you!!!
Posts.Title: How many years have you been a Survivor? IllinoisNancy Lou789

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2011 03:12PM Godlistens wrote: Cellist, thank you....it's always nice to hear some reassuring words!.....As I'm sure you know, there is no peace of mind with this disease!!  Good luck to you too! I assume you play the cello....
Posts.Title: CEA level went from 1.3 to 2.4 - should I be worried? Godlistens Godlistens

Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2010 03:17PM Godlistens wrote: I know how you feel, and I am three years out. I've stopped dying my hair so it is white and I feel like an old lady. Not to mention the headaches and body aches from the Tamoxifen. I wish I could have my life back before the BC - when I didn't have to feel guilty about everything I put in my mouth for fear it will bring back the BC; when I didn't have to feel guilty about not exercising.....when I didn't have to just plain worry about cancer......I want that life back.... You are not alone.
Posts.Title: Feel so negative about everything mari65 hopefulhealing

Posts.Content: Godlistens wrote: Hi ladies, I haven't been here in awhile but I always turn to you when I need consoling or for advice.  YOu sometimes know more than the doctors!  My oncologist does bloodwork every six months when I go for my regular appointments. My results from this round of bloodwork were normal.  However, I had a copy of the report faxed to me.  Six months ago, my CEA level was 1.3, this time it is 2.4.  That is almost double although it is still within the normal range.  Also, my onc. changed labs, and I noticed the normal range is different than the prior lab.... I would appreciate any input on this.......should I be concerned? Dr. says everything is normal.  Diagnosed 11/26/07 with IDC; Stage 1, Grade 2, Lumpectomy, then 37 rads, Onctotype was 12 thus no chemo; Tamox for five years Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: CEA level went from 1.3 to 2.4 - should I be worried? Godlistens Godlistens

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2012 11:11AM Godlistens wrote: Armadillo1 - are you OK???
Posts.Title: CEA level went from 1.3 to 2.4 - should I be worried? Godlistens Godlistens

Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2010 03:24PM Godlistens wrote: yes, everyone seems so busy.  I work from home and sometimes feel a bit isolated from the rest of the world. I had a lot of support in the beginning but now everyone has gone on with their lives, and I guess that's as it should be. ..... I worry about the damn thing coming back but that's part of the territory. I try to keep busy but don't put too much pressure on myself to be busy constantly. I have no desire to be busy constantly......I work from home part time, I take yoga classes, and I'm taking a college course in music. I also pray a lot and God listens.  Just because you don't hear from people frequently, it does not mean they are not thinking of you and loving you. You also have support here!!! I have learned that we each must make our own lives and find our own fulfillment with or without breast cancer!!  Try to find what makes you happy and do it...........hugs to you.
